result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Rivera

records.addlTxt: 11/4/22: Amended bond mailed to defendant for signature and return.  smr

11/4/22:  No contact provision modified as follows: No contact with Victim 1 unless in writing and about the children, no contact with Victim 1's residence, no contact with Victim 1's children.
*Take all prescribed medications *Absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substances.  May be subject to random UA's.
Status hearing on November 23, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

*No contact with Victim 1, her residence or her children. *Take all prescribed medications *Absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substances.  May be subject to random UA's.

State filed the Information.  Atty Frank received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Atty Frank does not request substitution.
Atty Frank states there is a stipulation for bond modification.  Atty Juech agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Bond will be modified to a $1,000 cash bond with continued conditions.

11:30 AM Defendant Nicholas A Rivera in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Nicholas A Rivera.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Frank states defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.

*No contact with Victim 1, her residence or her children. *Take all prescribed medications *Absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substances.  May be subject to random UA's.

1:07 PM Defendant Nicholas A Rivera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech requests $10,000 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant requests signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court will set $5,000 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
